hold 5% or more of the outstanding Common Stock have been excluded from the
calculation of this amount because such persons may be deemed to be
affiliates.&#160; This determination of affiliate

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<h3 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">PART
I</font></b></h3>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">This Report contains certain
statements of a forward-looking nature relating to future events or the future
performance of the Company.&#160; Words such
as </font></i>&#147;<i><font style="font-style:italic;">expects,</font></i>&#148;<i><font style="font-style:italic;">  </font></i>&#147;<i><font style="font-style:italic;">anticipates,</font></i>&#148;<i><font style="font-style:italic;">  </font></i>&#147;<i><font style="font-style:italic;">intends,</font></i>&#148;<i><font style="font-style:italic;">  </font></i>&#147;<i><font style="font-style:italic;">plans,</font></i>&#148;<i><font style="font-style:italic;">  </font></i>&#147;<i><font style="font-style:italic;">believes,</font></i>&#148;<i><font style="font-style:italic;">  </font></i>&#147;<i><font style="font-style:italic;">seeks,</font></i>&#148;<i><font style="font-style:italic;">  </font></i>&#147;<i><font style="font-style:italic;">estimates</font></i>&#148;<i><font style="font-style:italic;"> and similar
expressions or variations of such words are intended to identify
forward-looking statements, but are not the only means of identifying
forward-looking statements.&#160; Prospective
investors are cautioned that such statements are only predictions and that
actual events or results may differ materially.&#160; In evaluating such statements, prospective investors should
specifically consider various factors identified in this Report, including the
matters set forth below under the caption </font></i>&#147;<i><font style="font-style:italic;">Risk Factors,</font></i>&#148;<i><font style="font-style:italic;"> which could
cause actual results to differ materially from those indicated by such
forward-looking statements.</font></i></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 1.&#160; <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Business</font></i></font></b></p>

<h4 align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h4>

<h4 align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">General</font></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Founded
in 1980, our primary business is the design, development, manufacture,
marketing and support of magnetic tape data automation solutions.&#160; Businesses use these solutions for backup,
archival and data interchange functions in high-availability network computing
environments.&#160; Our products address the
data storage needs of companies, from small businesses and branch offices to
large enterprises, that have become increasingly dependent upon their stored
digital computer data and must guarantee its integrity and availability to
ensure business continuity.&#160; Our primary
storage system solutions are designed around a modular, scalable architecture
to enable customers to purchase storage when they need it, and to add to that
storage in increments that can be integrated into a single system.&#160; This design includes redundant robotic
mechanisms as well as other high-availability features that enable our systems
to provide access to data 24 hours a day, seven days a week.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Increasingly,
the management and protection of that data has moved from a peripheral concern
to a central issue in computing, due to several factors, including:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The shift from large mainframe computers to
network server computing;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The exponential growth in digital content made
possible by new technologies that make it easy and cost-effective to transform,
move, access and store mass amounts of digital content including graphics,
video and audio; and</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The dramatic growth of the Internet and
electronic commerce, which has significantly increased stored digital content.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our
strategy is to focus on providing mid-range storage solutions, which represents
the fastest growing segment of the IT market.&#160;
We have specifically designed our products to address the mid-range
market.&#160; Our primary products are
modularly-scalable which give them a low cost of entry, incremental expansion
ability and preservation of original equipment investment.&#160; We believe that these features are
particularly attractive for customers in difficult economic times, when IT
budgets are constrained.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our
primary products are automated tape libraries and loaders which combine
electro-mechanical robotics, electronic hardware and firmware developed
internally with an emphasis on efficiency of design, functionality and
reliability.&#160; We also distribute
products manufactured by other original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and
market various other products including spare parts and tape media.&#160; We also license a proprietary tape encoding
technology that we developed and patented under the name Variable Rate
Randomizer or &#147;VR<sup>2</sup>&#148;&#174;.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
June&nbsp;2002, we entered the software market and launched a new </font>family
of open storage management software solutions.&#160;
To date, revenues generated from the Overland Storage Resource Manager
have not been material.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June&nbsp;2003, we
announced the acquisition of Okapi Software, Inc., a privately-owned company
based in San Diego, California.&#160; Through
this acquisition, we entered the emerging market of intelligent, disk-based
appliances based on iSCSI and Serial ATA disk technologies.&#160; The Okapi backup accelerator product
complements our existing family of tape automation products.&#160; In August&nbsp;2003, we announced general
availability of three new Overland-branded disk-based products based on the
Okapi technology.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We were formerly known as Overland Data, Inc., but
changed our name on June&nbsp;28, 2002 to Overland Storage, Inc. to reflect our
expanded commitment to both hardware and software storage solutions.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='2',FILE='C:\jms\jpatrow\03-3540-1\task28550\3540-1-be.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Sep 24 19:54 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Products</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are the world&#146;s largest provider of mid-range
automated tape storage solutions.&#160;&#160; Our
products incorporate the leading tape technologies based on tape drives
supplied by other manufacturers.&#160; Such
technologies include:</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>LTO (Linear Tape
Open), supplied by a consortium including Hewlett-Packard Company (HP),
International Business Machines Corporation (IBM) and Certance LLC, formerly
Seagate Technology;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>DLTtape, the
current leading half-inch tape technology supplied by Quantum Corporation; and</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>AIT (Advanced
Intelligent Tape), supplied by Sony Electronics, Inc.</p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Through March&nbsp;2002, we also sold a line of IBM
compatible 36-track products called TapeXpress&#174; which served the large
installed base of AS400 and RS6000 minicomputers.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-style:italic;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Libraries</i> -
Automated tape libraries are devices capable of managing multiple data
cartridges and incorporate two or more tape drives to provide unattended backup
of large quantities of data.&#160; We
currently offer the following library products:</p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-style:italic;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Scalable
Neo series&#153;</i> &#150; Introduced in March&nbsp;2001, the Neo2000 was the first
product in our newest family of tape libraries and our third generation of
modularly scalable products.&#160; Neo offers
true scalability so that customers can start with a single module and later
expand their storage capacity to meet their growing business needs, while
protecting their original Neo module investment.&#160; In a 5U-high (8.75 inches) module, the Neo2000 supports up to two
drives and 30 media slots, representing one of the highest tape storage densities
in the industry.&#160; Up to eight modules
may be configured and rack-mounted into one Neo series library system.&#160; Each multi-module library system operates as
a single virtual library.&#160; In
October&nbsp;2001, we announced the Neo4000, which supports up to four drives
and 60 media slots and can be configured with up to four modules in a single
rack.&#160; Customers can also configure Neo
systems with a combination of Neo2000 and Neo4000 modules.&#160; Modules may be configured with DLT8000,
SuperDLT (SDLT) or LTO drives, allowing customers to optimize compatibility,
capacity and performance.&#160; Incorporating
the third generation of our expandable, modular robotics, the Neo series may be
configured with redundant hot swap drives, power supplies and robotics.&#160; The distributed robotic architecture
provides separate robotics for each library in a multi-module Neo series
system.&#160; The optional Neo series
internal Fibre Channel interface uses Small Form-Factor Pluggable transceiver
modules for direct Storage Area Network (SAN) connection.&#160; The embedded WebTLC feature enables
web-based library monitoring, control and fail-over management via a standard
remote browser.&#160; In September&nbsp;2003
we announced the Neo8000, which we expect to begin shipping in
December&nbsp;2003.&#160; The Neo8000 family
consists of a base model with a 100 cartridge capacity which can be scaled up
to 500 cartridges through a field-enabled software key.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-style:italic;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>PowerLoaders and
Loaders</i> - Automated tape loaders are devices capable of managing multiple
data cartridges to provide unattended backup of data.&#160; We currently offer the following products:</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-style:italic;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>PowerLoader<a name="OLE_LINK1"> &#150; </a></i>an
automated desktop or rack mount solution with one or two tape drives and a&#160; multi-cartridge magazine configured with
LTO, SDLT, DLT 8000 or AIT drives.&#160; We
define PowerLoaders as tape libraries, with one or two tape drives, which
cannot be scaled or configured with multiple modules.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-style:italic;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Loader</i>
&#150; an automated desktop or rack mount solution with a single tape drive and a
multi-cartridge magazine configured with an LTO, SDLT, DLT 8000 or AIT drive.</p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='3',FILE='C:\jms\jpatrow\03-3540-1\task28550\3540-1-be.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Sep 24 19:54 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-style:italic;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Disk-based
Products &#150;</i> In August&nbsp;2003 we began shipping our Reo Series&#153; of
disk-based products based on the technology of Okapi Software, Inc.&#160; The Reo product family consists of three
products: (i) the R2000 application backup and recovery acceleration appliance;
(ii) the RA2000 backup server acceleration appliance; and (iii) the RX2000
recovery expansion module for both the R2000 and the RA2000.&#160; These backup appliances enable companies to
reduce backup and restore times by backing up multiple servers simultaneously
to disk and immediately releasing those servers back to production.&#160; The Reo can then be seamlessly backed up to
tape using existing backup software.&#160;
This can all be done through the use of a customer&#146;s existing Ethernet
infrastructure, avoiding the costly and complicated installation of a dedicated
fibre channel network.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-style:italic;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Drives</i> &#150;
These desktop or internal upgrade tape drives accommodate a single data
cartridge.&#160; We currently offer the
following tape drives:</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-style:italic;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>LTO
&#150;</i> an LTO1 or LTO2 Ultrium drive supplied by HP.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-style:italic;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>DLTtape
&#150;</i> a DLT8000, SDLT220 or SDLT320 drive supplied by Quantum.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-style:italic;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Other Products
and Services&#150;</i> We have a variety of products and services supporting our
Libraries, PowerLoaders, Loaders and tape drives.&#160; We currently offer the following additional products and
services:</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Spares and post
warranty return-to-factory and on-site service.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Media, including
tape cartridges for DLT, SDLT, AIT and LTO formats.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-style:italic;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>VR<sup>2</sup>  </i>(Variable
Rate Randomizer) <i><font style="font-style:italic;">&#150; </font></i>VR<sup>2</sup><i><font style="font-style:italic;">  </font></i>is our patented data<sup>  </sup>encoding
technology based on Partial Response Maximum <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Likelihood</font></i> (PRML).&#160; This technology, which is embedded in an
Applications Specific Integrated Circuit (ASIC) chip, is capable of
significantly increasing the native capacity and data transfer rate performance
of linear tape technologies without requiring any changes in tape path design,
recording heads and/or media.&#160; This
performance is accomplished by achieving encoding efficiency of greater than
99%.&#160; We have licensed VR<sup>2 </sup>to
Tandberg Data ASA for use in its Scalable Linear Recording (SLR) tape drives,
to Imation Corporation as the owner of the Travan technology format, to
Certance, formerly Seagate, for use in its Travan tape drive offerings, to
Storage Technology Corporation (StorageTek) for use in its 9940 Eagle drives
and future tape drive products, and to Quantum.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our Libraries, PowerLoaders, Loaders and tape drives are installed on
specific computer platforms with the appropriate backup, data interchange or
storage management software.&#160; We
actively work with a number of backup and storage management software companies
to confirm that our products are properly supported. Currently, more than 80
different software packages support our tape automation products. For example,
on the Novell NetWare and Microsoft Windows NT platforms, the software packages
include products from Computer Associates International, Inc., Veritas Software
Corporation, Legato Systems Incorporated, and Dantz Development Corp. On UNIX
platforms, the software packages include products from Legato, IBM/Tivoli, HP
and Veritas Software Corporation.&#160; On
Linux platforms, software packages supported include Knox Software and BakBone
Software, Inc.&#160; Our Neo series of tape
libraries also supports SAN attachment for one and two-gigabit fibre channel
connectivity to provide serverless backup and shared library capability.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Sales and Marketing</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our
structure is optimized for our mid-range strategy in that we are not required
to have a direct sales or service force.&#160;
</font>We sell all our products on an indirect basis, primarily through
three channels or types of customers: (i)&nbsp;OEMs; (ii)&nbsp;commercial
distributors; and (iii) volume, consisting of systems integrators, technical
distributors and value added resellers (VARs).&#160;
Regardless of the channel through which they are sold, all of our products
are designed and manufactured to meet OEM-level requirements and reliability
standards.&#160; Because the OEM
qualification process can take six to 18 months to complete, we often make
initial sales of new products to non-OEM customers that typically evaluate,
integrate and adopt new technologies and products more quickly. After
qualification and acceptance, OEM sales generally represent an increasing
proportion of a product&#146;s unit sales and are important to us in terms of
validating our products in the marketplace and achieving desirable production
volumes.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><b><i><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>OEM Channel</i></b>
- - Our significant OEM supply agreements are with HP and IBM, both of which
incorporate our products into their system offerings.&#160; Fujitsu and NEC also purchase Neo products and sell them under
their respective labels.&#160; However, we
are required to sell to them through their appointed reseller, and consequently
we classify them as Volume customers rather than OEM customers.</p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='4',FILE='C:\jms\jpatrow\03-3540-1\task28550\3540-1-be.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Sep 24 19:54 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">HP</font></i></b>.&#160;
In June&nbsp;1999 after its acquisition of Digital Equipment Corp,
Compaq Computer Corporation, selected us as an OEM supplier for DLT automated
storage products supporting the leading Compaq ProLiant server line.&#160; In June&nbsp;2000, Compaq added our AIT
LibraryPro.&#160; In May&nbsp;2001, Compaq
added to its product line the next generation Neo series DLT automated storage
products.&#160; And in May&nbsp;2002, after
its acquisition of Compaq, HP selected Overland to be its supplier of mid-range
tape automation products.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">IBM</font></i></b>.&#160;
IBM has been our customer since fiscal year 1997, but was buying older
36-track technology products that we discontinued in March&nbsp;2002.&#160; In June&nbsp;2002, we were selected by a
division of IBM to supply its mid-range tape automation needs and we began
shipping Neo products under this agreement in November&nbsp;2002.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In general, we work with
our OEM customers early in a new product development cycle to design products
to meet their specifications. The OEM sales cycle is often lengthy and
typically consists of a general technology evaluation, qualification of product
specifications, verification of product performance against these
specifications, integration testing of the product within the customers&#146;
systems, product announcement and volume shipment. As is typical in the
industry, our OEM contracts have a three year term, provide for periodic price
reviews and the customers are not required to purchase minimum quantities.&#160; Our existing contracts with HP and IBM also
provide that title to inventory shipped from our warehouse into various
inventory hub locations remains with Overland until the products are shipped to
their customers.&#160; HP, including the
former Compaq which HP acquired in May&nbsp;2002, has been our largest
customer, accounting for approximately 58%, 62% and 63% of sales in fiscal
years 2003, 2002 and 2001, respectively.&#160;
No other customer accounted for more than 10% of sales in any year
during the three-year period.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><b><i><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Commercial
Distribution Channel</i></b> - Our primary commercial distribution customers
include Ingram Micro, Inc., Tech Data Corporation and Bell Microproducts, Inc.
in the U.S. and Ideal Hardware, a division of Bell Microproducts, in the
U.K.&#160; Typically, these distributors sell
our products to smaller VARs and catalogers who in turn sell to end-users.&#160; The distribution agreements include
provisions for stock rotation and price protection, common terms in the
commercial distribution area.&#160; We do not
have the ability to estimate our exposure for returned product or price
adjustments, so we do not record revenue in this channel until the distributor
sells the related inventory.&#160; We support
these distributors through a dedicated field sales force and provide further
support through field sales personnel who work with the smaller VARs and
catalogers to generate end-user sales and create the pull through its
distribution customers.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><b><i><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Volume Channel</i></b>
- - Our volume channel includes systems integrators, technical distributors and
larger VARs.&#160; Some of our volume channel
customers specialize in the insurance, banking, financial, geophysical or
medical industries, and offer a variety of value-added services relating to our
products.&#160; Our products frequently are
packaged by these customers as part of a complete data processing system or
combined with other storage devices, such as redundant array of independent
disks (RAID) systems, to deliver a complete storage subsystem.&#160; These customers also recommend our products
as replacement solutions when backup systems are upgraded, and bundle our
products with storage management software specific to the end-user&#146;s
system.&#160; We support this channel through
our field sales representatives.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our products are sold both domestically and internationally and we have
sales personnel located in various cities throughout the world.&#160; We divide our sales into three geographies:
(1)&nbsp;the Americas, consisting of North and South America; (2) Europe,
Middle East and Africa (EMEA); and (3) Asia Pacific (APAC).&#160; Primary support for customers in the
Americas is provided from our San Diego headquarters office.&#160; EMEA is supported by our wholly-owned
subsidiaries located in Wokingham, England; Paris, France; and Munich,
Germany.&#160; The subsidiary in England
provides sales, technical support and repair services, while the subsidiaries
in France and Germany provide sales and technical support.&#160; In November&nbsp;2001, we opened a sales
office in Singapore to support our APAC customers.&#160; We assign to our international distributors the right to sell our
products in a country or group of countries.&#160;
In addition, many domestic customers ship a portion of our products to
their overseas customers.&#160; Our foreign
sales for fiscal years 2003, 2002 and 2001 were approximately $85.1 million,
$77.1 million and $73.8 million, respectively, representing 43%, 47% and 47%,
respectively, of our total net revenues.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We support our sales efforts with various marketing programs designed to
build our brand name and attract new customers.&#160; Our branded channel partners are provided with a full range of
marketing materials, including product specification literature, software
connectivity information and application notes.&#160; Our sales management and engineering personnel provide support to
the channel partners and, in certain instances, visit potential customer sites
to explain and demonstrate the technical advantages of our products.&#160; In addition, we hold annual Partner
Conferences to inform our channel partners of new product developments and
programs and to discuss emerging trends in their markets.&#160; We also maintain press relations both
domestically and in Europe, advertise in computer systems publications targeted
to our end-users and channel partners, and offer market development funds to
our channel partners.&#160; We participate in
national and regional trade shows in varying degrees both domestically and
internationally, including the CeBIT show in Germany and domestically at</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='5',FILE='C:\jms\jpatrow\03-3540-1\task28550\3540-1-be.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Sep 24 19:54 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">NetWorld+Interop, PC Expo and Comdex.&#160; We also maintain a website
(http://www.overlandstorage.com) that features marketing information, product
specifications, news releases and application, service and technical support
notes and investor relations information.&#160;
</font>We make available through this website free of charge all of our
annual reports on Form 10-K, quarterly reports on Form 10-Q, current reports on
Form 8-K and amendments to those reports filed pursuant to Section&nbsp;13(a)
or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 as soon as reasonably
practicable after we file them electronically with, or furnish them to the
SEC.&#160; The content of our website is not
part of this Report.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Customer Service and Support</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our technical support
personnel are trained on our products and assist customers with &#147;plug-and-play&#148;
compatibility between multiple hardware platforms, operating systems and
backup, data interchange and storage management software.&#160; Our application engineers are available to
solve more complex customer problems and visit customer sites when
necessary.&#160; Customers that need service
and support can contact us through our toll-free telephone lines, facsimile and
Internet e-mail. &#160;Application notes and
user manuals can be obtained directly from our website.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We generally provide a
three year advance replacement return-to-factory warranty on our Neo Series,
PowerLoader and LoaderXpress products.&#160;
We also provide on-site service for the first warranty year of the Neo
Series products located in the United States and Canada, for which we contract
with third-party service providers.&#160; For
most products, we offer a program called XchangeNOW as part of our
return-to-factory warranty which enables customers to receive an advance
replacement unit shipped within two business days after placing a service
request.&#160; The customer ships the
defective unit back to us using the shipping materials from the replacement
unit.&#160; Separately priced on-site warranties
are offered for sale to customers of other product lines.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Research and Development</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We currently employ 40 people in our research and development department,
many of whom have extensive experience in the tape industry and significant
expertise in software architecture and design, electrical, mechanical and
firmware design.&#160; Our R&amp;D department
is capable of developing both tape drives and robotic mechanisms, including the
development of various aspects of data channels, data compression, intelligent
interfaces and firmware (embedded systems software).&#160; This department also has the ability to develop and test a tape
path, the core of any tape technology.&#160;
We believe that these capabilities distinguish us from our competitors
by providing us with a better understanding of data backup and recovery
technologies in general and enabling us to provide higher value-added content
by designing reliable products which better utilize the advantages of specific
technologies.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our
level of R&amp;D spending is dependent upon our product development
cycles.&#160; During the later stages of the
cycles, including the building of alpha and beta units and design verification
testing, significant amounts of development materials are consumed.&#160; OEM customers also generally require
evaluation units to qualify a new design.&#160;
During fiscal 2001, the majority of our R&amp;D efforts were focused on
the final development and introduction of our &#147;next generation&#148; Neo series of
automated tape libraries.&#160; In fiscal
2002, we concentrated on developing follow-on products that extend the Neo
series product line into larger systems and integrate additional tape drive
technologies.&#160; In fiscal 2003,
development efforts centered on supporting the launch of the new HP and IBM
specific products, as well as additions to our loader product family and the
development of the Neo8000.&#160; Separately,
general research will continue in the quest for future products and
technologies.&#160; Only a small portion of
our fiscal 2004 budget will be dedicated to software development for the newly
launched </font>open storage management software solutions because the majority of the code is being
obtained by license from other developers.&#160;
Our company sponsored R&amp;D expenditures amounted to $7.4 million,
$6.6 million and $10.1 million in fiscal years 2003, 2002 and 2001,
respectively, representing 3.8%, 4.0% and 6.5% of net revenues,
respectively.&#160; Despite our R&amp;D
efforts, we may not be able to identify, develop, manufacture, market or
support new or enhanced products successfully or on a timely basis and any new
products may not gain market acceptance.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='6',FILE='C:\jms\jpatrow\03-3540-1\task28550\3540-1-be.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Sep 24 19:54 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<h4 align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Manufacturing</font></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have a fully
integrated factory in San Diego, California that is ISO 9001 certified.&#160; Major OEM customers have also certified all
of our production lines and manufacturing processes.&#160; We perform product assembly, integration and testing, while
leaving component and piece-part manufacturing to our supplier partners.&#160; We work closely with a group of regional,
national and international suppliers, which are carefully selected based on
their ability to provide quality parts and components that meet our
specifications, as well as meet present and future volume requirements.&#160; Key suppliers are under contract to provide
just-in-time deliveries.&#160; We
specifically design a number of our parts and components that are not available
off the shelf for integration into our products.&#160; We maintain a minimum number of suppliers and utilize their
specific capabilities across several product lines.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In general,
Overland branded products are not manufactured until an order is received.&#160; The typical lead-time for manufacturing
products is three days and backlog is not a significant factor to our business.&#160; Our two largest OEM customers, HP and IBM,
both require that we maintain inventory on hand, known as buffer stock, at any
given time sufficient to supply their forecasted requirements for the next
three weeks.&#160; They provide weekly
forecast information that allows us to manage both raw material and finished
goods inventories.&#160; The buffer stock is
shipped into various distribution hubs around the world and we retain ownership
of that inventory until it is pulled by HP and IBM to fulfill customer orders,
at which time we record the sale.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June&nbsp;2001,
after making significant reductions in product lead times at our San Diego
factory, we discontinued manufacturing operations at our UK subsidiary.&#160; All branded products are now shipped to
European customers from San Diego.&#160;
However, the UK facility continues to serve as an inventory hub for HP
where our product is stored, staged and then shipped directly to HP&#146;s European
customers.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
March&nbsp;2002, we moved into a new headquarters building that was designed to
our specifications.&#160; The new facility
has improved our manufacturing efficiencies, increased our manufacturing
capacity, and provides room for future growth.&#160;
The building is subject to a 12-year lease with one five year extension
option. We believe that we have the capacity to support unit production levels
several times greater than our current rate of production.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During fiscal year
2003, we continued to operate a partial second shift, in addition to the
traditional single shift, to handle greater production levels, and we can
further expand capacity by adding to the second shift or moving to a full-time
factory.&#160; We maintain approximately 30%
of our direct labor in the form of temporary staffing to accommodate normal
business fluctuations and control our staffing levels carefully to meet
customer requirements at any specific time.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Competition</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
worldwide storage market is intensely competitive as a number of manufacturers
of tape automation solutions and storage management software products compete
for a limited number of customers.&#160; In
addition, barriers to entry are relatively low in these markets.&#160; We currently participate in the mid-range of
the tape backup market.&#160; In this
segment, some of our competitors have substantially greater financial and other
resources specifically larger research and development staffs.&#160; Our tape automation products currently
compete with products made by Advanced Digital Information Corporation, Quantum
Corporation and Storage Technology Corporation.<b><font style="font-weight:bold;">  </font></b>&#160;Key competitive factors in the tape storage market include capacity,
transfer rate, reliability, durability, scalability, compatibility and cost.
Our tape storage products also compete with other storage technologies, such as
hard disk drives. The ratio of price to performance for hard disk drives
continues to decline, and if such price/performance ratio declines faster the
than price/performance ratio for our tape solutions, the competition from hard
disk drives as an alternative backup solution will increase.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our
disk-based and software products currently compete with products made by
International Business Machines Corporation, HP, Computer Associates
International, Inc., EMC Corporation, Veritas Software Corporation, Quantum
Corporation, Network Appliance, Inc. and numerous small startups. We believe
additional competitors are likely to enter the market.&#160;&#160; Key competitive factors in these markets
include performance, functionality, scalability, availability,
interoperability, connectivity, time to market enhancements and total value of
ownership.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
markets for all of our products are characterized by significant price
competition, and we anticipate that our products will face increasing price
pressure.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='7',FILE='C:\jms\jpatrow\03-3540-1\task28550\3540-1-be.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Sep 24 19:54 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Proprietary Rights</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">General - </font></b><font style="font-weight:normal;">We believe that, because of the rapid pace of
technological change in the data storage industry, patent, copyright, trademark
and trade secret protection are less significant than factors such as the
knowledge, ability and experience of our personnel, new product introductions
and product enhancements.&#160; Despite these
factors, we still rely on a combination of patent, copyright, trademark and
trade secret protection, non-disclosure agreements and licensing arrangements
to establish and protect our proprietary rights.&#160; We presently hold 17</font>  <font style="font-weight:normal;">United States patents and have one</font>  <font style="font-weight:normal;">United States patent
application. In general, these patents have a 20 year term from the first
effective filing date for each patent.&#160;
We also hold a number of foreign patents and patent applications for
certain of our products and technologies.&#160;
</font><font style="font-weight:normal;">These rights, however, may not
prevent competitors from developing substantially equivalent or superior
products to ours.&#160; In addition, our
present and future patents may be challenged, invalidated or circumvented, reducing
or eliminating our proprietary protection.</font></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">VR<sup>2</sup> Technology</font></b>
&#150; We have entered into various intellectual property licensing agreements
relating to our VR<sup>2</sup> technology.&#160;
These agreements typically call for an initial payment to us for the
delivery of the VR<sup>2 </sup>technology platform and royalty fees based on
sales by licensees of products containing VR<sup>2</sup>.&#160; In certain instances, we may elect to sell
to the licensee ASIC chips embodying VR<sup>2 </sup>priced to include the cost
of the chip plus an embedded royalty fee.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Employees</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of June&nbsp;30, 2003
we had 377 employees, including 111 in sales and marketing, 40 in research and
development, 180 in manufacturing and operations and 46 in finance, information
systems, human resources and other management.&#160;
There are no collective bargaining contracts covering any of the
employees and we believe that our relationship with our employees is good.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='8',FILE='C:\jms\jpatrow\03-3540-1\task28550\3540-1-be.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Sep 24 19:54 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">RISK FACTORS</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">An investment in our company involves a high degree of
risk.&#160; In addition to the other
information included in this Report, you should carefully consider the
following risk factors in evaluating an investment in our company.&#160; You should consider these matters in
conjunction with the other information included or incorporated by reference in
thisReport.</font></i></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our business is highly dependent on
our level of sales to one major customer</font></b><i><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;">.</font></i></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Hewlett
Packard, including the former Compaq which HP acquired in May&nbsp;2002, has
been our largest customer accounting for approximately 58% of net revenues in
fiscal year 2003, 62% of net revenues in fiscal year 2002 and 63% of net
revenues in fiscal year 2001.&#160; No other
customer accounted for more than 10% of net revenues during the year ended
June&nbsp;30, 2003.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Our
sales to HP may be affected adversely by various factors relating to HP&#146;s
business, liquidity, results of operation and financial position.&#160; We expect that HP will continue to represent
a significant portion of our revenues in future periods.&#160; Consequently, our business, liquidity,
results of operation and financial position would be materially and adversely
affected by the loss of the HP account, or the reduction, delay or cancellation
of HP orders.&#160; Neither HP nor any other
customer is obligated to purchase a specific amount of our products or provide
binding forecasts of purchases for any period.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">The market price of our common
stock may be very volatile</font></b><i><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-style:italic;">.</font></i></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">The
market price of our common stock has experienced significant fluctuations since
it commenced trading in February&nbsp;1997.&#160;
The market price of our common stock may continue to fluctuate
significantly in the future.&#160; Many
factors could cause the market price of our common stock to fluctuate,
including:</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">announcements concerning us or our competitors;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">changes in earnings estimates by analysts;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">purchasing decisions of HP and other significant customers;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">quarterly variations in operating results;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">the introduction of new technologies or products;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">changes in product pricing policies by us or our competitors; and</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">changes in general economic conditions.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">In
addition, stock markets have experienced extreme price and volume volatility in
recent years.&#160; This volatility has had a
substantial effect on the market prices of securities of many smaller public
companies for reasons frequently unrelated or disproportionate to the operating
performance of the specific companies.&#160;
These market fluctuations may adversely affect the market price of our
common stock.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our financial results may fluctuate
substantially for many reasons, and past results should not be relied on as
indications of future performance.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">All of
the markets that we serve are volatile and subject to market shifts, which we
may not be able to discern in advance. A slowdown in the demand for
workstations, mid-range computer systems, networks and servers could have a
significant adverse effect on the demand for our products in any given
period.&#160; We have experienced delays in
receipt of purchase orders and, on occasion, anticipated purchase orders have
been rescheduled or have not materialized due to changes in customer
requirements.&#160; Our customers may cancel
or delay purchase orders for a variety of reasons, including the rescheduling
of new product introductions, changes in their inventory practices or
forecasted demand, general economic conditions affecting our customers&#146;
markets, changes in our pricing or the pricing of our competitors, new product
announcements by us or others, quality or reliability problems related to our
products or selection of competitive products as alternate sources of
supply.&#160; In particular, our ability to
forecast sales to distributors, integrators and value-added resellers is
especially limited as these customers typically provide to us relatively short
order lead times or are permitted to change orders on short notice.&#160; Given that a large portion of our sales are
generated by our European channel, our first fiscal quarter (July&nbsp;through
September) is commonly impacted by seasonally slow European orders, reflecting
the summer holiday period in Europe.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">9</font></p>


<div style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='9',FILE='C:\jms\jpatrow\03-3540-1\task28550\3540-1-be.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Sep 24 19:54 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font></font>

<p align="center" style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">In
addition, our financial results have fluctuated and will continue to fluctuate
quarterly and annually based on many other factors such as:</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">changes in customer mix (e.g., OEM vs. branded);</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">the level of utilization of our production capacity;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">changes in product mix;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">fluctuations in average selling prices;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">manufacturing yields;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">increases in production and engineering costs associated with initial
production of new products;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">increases in the cost of or limitations on availability of materials;
and</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">labor shortages.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
