<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Based on
all of the foregoing, we believe that our revenues and operating results will
continue to fluctuate, and period-to-period comparisons are not necessarily
meaningful and should not be relied on as indications of future
performance.&#160; Furthermore, in some
future quarters, our revenues and operating results could be below the
expectations of public market analysts or investors, which could result in a
material adverse effect on the price of our common stock.&#160; In addition, portions of our expenses are
fixed and difficult to reduce if revenues do not meet our expectations.&#160; These fixed expenses magnify the material
adverse effect of any revenue shortfall.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">We face intense competition and price
pressure, and many of our competitors have substantially greater resources than
we do.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman"><font style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">The
worldwide storage market is intensely competitive as a number of manufacturers
of tape automation solutions and storage management software products compete
for a limited number of customers.&#160; In
addition, barriers to entry are relatively low in these markets.&#160; We currently participate in the mid-range of
the tape backup market.&#160; In this
segment, some of our competitors have substantially greater financial and other
resources, larger research and development staffs, and more experience and
capabilities in manufacturing, marketing and distributing products.&#160; Our hardware products currently compete with
products made by Advanced Digital Information Corporation, Quantum Corporation
and Storage Technology Corporation.&#160; </font>Our disk-based and software products currently
compete with products made by International Business Machines Corporation, HP,
Computer Associates International, Inc., EMC Corporation, Veritas Software
Corporation, Quantum Corporation, Network Appliance, Inc. and numerous small
startups.&#160; The markets for our products
are characterized by significant price competition, and we anticipate that our
products will face increasing price pressure.&#160;
This pressure could result in significant price erosion, reduced profit
margins and loss of market share, which could have a material adverse effect on
our business, liquidity, results of operation and financial position.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our business is highly dependent on the
continued availability and market acceptance of the tape technologies
incorporated in our products.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">We
derive a majority of our revenue from products that incorporate tape drives
purchased from other manufacturers and based on unique formats and tape technologies.&#160; Certain of these tape drives are only
available from a single manufacturer, and we expect to continue to derive a
substantial amount of our revenue from products incorporating these tape drives
for the foreseeable future.&#160; In
particular, a portion of our products incorporate DLTtape drives manufactured
by Quantum Corporation.&#160; Quantum also is
one of our competitors because Quantum markets its own tape automation
products.&#160; We do not have a long-term
contract with Quantum, which could cease supplying tape drives directly to
us.&#160; Although Quantum has licensed
Tandberg Data to be a second source manufacturer of DLTtape drives, we have not
qualified Tandberg as an alternative supplier.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">In
addition, from time to time in the past, we have not obtained as many drives as
we have needed from various vendors due to drive shortages or quality
issues.&#160; Any prolonged inability to
obtain adequate deliveries could require us to pay more for components, parts
and other supplies, seek alternative sources of supply, delay shipment of
products and damage relationships with current and prospective customers.&#160; This type of delay or damage could have a
material adverse effect on our business, liquidity, results of operation and
financial position.&#160; In the past, we experienced
problems with the supply of a newly-introduced tape drives and these problems
adversely affected our sales and earnings.&#160;
We cannot assure you that these</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">10</font></p>


<div style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='10',FILE='C:\jms\jpatrow\03-3540-1\task28550\3540-1-be.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Sep 24 19:54 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font></font>

<p align="center" style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">or similar problems will
not reoccur, or that we will not experience similar or more serious disruptions
in supply in the future with current or new versions of tape drives.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Our
future operating results depend on the continued availability and market
acceptance of the current tape technologies that we use.&#160; If tape drives incorporating other
technologies gain comparable or superior market acceptance than those currently
incorporated in our products, then we might have to modify the design of our
tape automation products to incorporate these tape drives.&#160; Our inability to do so or to obtain
sufficient quantities of these tape drives could have a material adverse effect
on our business, liquidity, results of operation and financial position.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Our tape-based storage solutions
compete with other storage technologies, such as hard disk drives, and may face
competition in the future from other emerging technologies. The prices of hard
disk drives continue to decrease while capacity and performance have increased.
If hard disk drives or products incorporating other technologies gain
comparable or superior market acceptance to tape drive technology, or their
costs decline far more rapidly than tape drive and media costs, we would face
increased competition from these alternative technologies. If we are not able
to respond to such competition through increased performance and lower prices
for our products, or the introduction of competitive new products incorporating
new technologies, our business, financial condition and operating results could
be materially and adversely affected.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our success depends on our ability to
anticipate rapid technological changes and develop new and enhanced products.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">As an
advanced technology company, we are subject to numerous risks and
uncertainties, generally characterized by rapid technological change and
intense competition.&#160; In this
environment, our future success will depend on our ability to anticipate
changes in technology, to develop new and enhanced products on a timely and cost-effective
basis and to introduce, manufacture and achieve market acceptance of these new
and enhanced products.&#160; Development
schedules for high technology products are inherently subject to
uncertainty.&#160; We may not meet our
product development schedules, including those for products based on our VR<sup>2</sup>
technology or storage management software products, and development costs could
exceed budgeted amounts.&#160; In addition,
there can be no assurance that our licensees, in the case of our VR<sup>2 </sup>technology,
or our licensors, in the case of our software products, will meet their product
development schedules.&#160; Our business,
liquidity, results of operation and financial position may be materially and
adversely affected if the products or product enhancements that we develop are
delayed or not delivered due to developmental problems, quality issues or
component shortage problems, or if our products or product enhancements do not
achieve market acceptance or are unreliable.&#160;
The introduction, whether by us or our competitors, of new products
embodying new technologies, such as new sequential or random access mass
storage devices, and the emergence of new industry standards could render
existing products obsolete or not marketable, which may have a material adverse
effect on our business, liquidity, results of operation and financial position.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">We rely on outside suppliers to
provide a large number of components and subassemblies incorporated in our
products.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Our
products have a large number of components and subassemblies produced by
outside suppliers.&#160; Accordingly, we
depend greatly on these suppliers for tape drives, printed circuit boards and
integrated circuits, which are essential to the manufacture of our
products.&#160; In addition, for certain of
these items, we qualify only a single source, which can magnify the risk of
shortages and decrease our ability to negotiate with our suppliers on the basis
of price.&#160; If these shortages occur, or
if we experience quality problems with suppliers, then our product shipments
could be significantly delayed or costs significantly increased, which would
have a material adverse effect on our business, liquidity, results of operation
and financial position.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our international operations are
important to our business and involve unique risks.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Historically,
sales to customers outside of the U.S. have represented a significant portion
of our sales and we expect them to continue representing a significant portion
of sales.&#160; Sales to customers outside
the U.S. are subject to various risks, including:</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">the imposition of governmental controls mandating compliance with
various foreign and U.S. export laws;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">currency exchange fluctuations;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">political and economic instability;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">trade restrictions;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">changes in tariffs and taxes;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">11</font></p>


<div style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='11',FILE='C:\jms\jpatrow\03-3540-1\task28550\3540-1-be.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Sep 24 19:54 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">longer payment cycles (typically associated with international sales);
and</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">difficulties in staffing and managing international operations.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Furthermore,
we cannot assure that we will be able to comply with changes in foreign
standards in the future, even though we endeavor to meet standards established
by foreign regulatory bodies.&#160; Our
inability to design products that comply with foreign standards could have a
material adverse effect on our business, liquidity, results of operation and
financial position.&#160; Currently, nearly
all of our international sales are denominated in U.S. dollars and fluctuations
in the value of foreign currencies relative to the U.S. dollar could,
therefore, make our products less price competitive.&#160; Additionally, the expenses of our international subsidiaries are
denominated in their local currencies.&#160;
We currently do not engage in foreign currency hedging transactions, and
we are therefore exposed to some level of currency risk.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our ability to compete effectively
depends in part on our ability to protect effectively our intellectual property
rights.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman"><font style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">We rely
on a combination of patent, copyright, trademark, trade secret and other
intellectual property laws to protect our intellectual property rights.&#160; These rights, however, may not prevent
competitors from developing products that are substantially equivalent or
superior to our products.</font> To the extent we have or obtain patents, such
patents may not afford meaningful protection for our technology and products.
Others may challenge our patents and, as a result, our patents could be
narrowed, invalidated or unenforceable. In addition, current or future patent
applications may not result in the issuance of patents in the United States or
foreign countries.&#160; In addition, the laws of
certain foreign countries may not protect our intellectual property to the same
extent as U.S. laws.&#160; Furthermore,
competitors may independently develop similar products, duplicate our products
or, if patents are issued to us, design around these patents.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In order to protect or
enforce our patent rights, we may initiate interference proceedings,
oppositions, or patent litigation against third parties, such as infringement
suits. These lawsuits could be expensive, take significant time and divert
management&#146;s attention from other business concerns. The patent position of
information technology firms generally is highly uncertain, involves complex
legal and factual questions, and has recently been the subject of much
litigation. No consistent policy has emerged from the U.S. Patent and Trademark
Office or the courts regarding the breadth of claims allowed or the degree of
protection afforded under information technology patents.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Raytheon Company has sued us for
patent infringement.&#160; This litigation
subjects us to significant liabilities, costs and expenses.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">In
January&nbsp;2003, Raytheon Company filed a lawsuit against us and various
other companies in the United States District Court for the Eastern District of
Texas.&#160; The complaint alleges that our
products infringe United States Patent No.&nbsp;5,412,791, entitled Mass Data
Storage Library.&#160; In the complaint,
Raytheon demands that the defendants stop selling infringing products, pay
Raytheon for their past use of the invention under the patent and pay
Raytheon&#146;s costs and expenses and its reasonable attorney fees.&#160; An adverse outcome in the Raytheon
litigation (or similar proceedings) could:</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">subject us to significant liabilities;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">require us to license disputed rights from Raytheon or others; or</font></p>

<p style="color:red;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-size:10.0pt;layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">require us to cease marketing or using some products.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Any of these events could
have a material adverse effect on our business, liquidity, results of operation
and financial position.&#160; In addition,
even if we do not experience an adverse outcome in the Raytheon litigation, or
similar proceedings, the legal fees and other costs and expenses associated
with litigation have and may continue to be substantial and may adversely
impact our business, liquidity, results of operation and financial position.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12</font></p>


<div align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='12',FILE='C:\jms\jpatrow\03-3540-1\task28550\3540-1-be.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Sep 24 19:54 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our
success will depend partly on our ability to operate without infringing on or
misappropriating the proprietary rights of others.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition to the
Raytheon litigation discussed above, we may be sued for infringing on the
patent rights or misappropriating the proprietary rights of others.
Intellectual property litigation is costly, and, even if we prevail, the cost
of such litigation could adversely affect our business, financial condition and
results of operations. In addition, litigation is time consuming and could
divert management attention and resources away from our business. If we do not
prevail in any litigation, we could be required to stop the infringing activity
and/or pay substantial damages. Under some circumstances in the United States,
these damages could be triple the actual damages the patent holder incurs. If
we have supplied infringing products to third parties for marketing or licensed
third parties to manufacture, use or market infringing products, we may be
obligated to indemnify these third parties for any damages they may be required
to pay to the patent holder and for any losses the third parties may sustain
themselves as the result of lost sales or damages paid to the patent holder.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If a third party holding
rights under a patent successfully asserts an infringement claim with respect
to any of our products, we may be prevented from manufacturing or marketing our
infringing product in the country or countries covered by the patent we
infringe, unless we can obtain a license from the patent holder. Any required
license may not be available to us on acceptable terms, or at all. Some
licenses may be non-exclusive, and therefore, our competitors may have access
to the same technology licensed to us. If we fail to obtain a required license
or are unable to design around a patent, we may be unable to market some of our
products, which could have a material adverse effect on our business, financial
condition and results of operations.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our new software and disk-based
products involve many significant risks.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June&nbsp;2002, we
announced the launch of our first software product, the Overland Storage
Resource Manager and in August&nbsp;2003 we began shipping our Reo Series of
disk-based products based on technology acquired from Okapi Software, Inc.&#160; To date, our sales generated from these
products has not been material.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">The success of these new products is uncertain and subject to
significant risks, any of which could have a material adverse effect on our
business, liquidity, results of operation and financial position.&#160; We must commit significant resources to
these new products before determining whether they will result in any
success.&#160; In addition, our disk-based
business is highly dependent upon the general industry acceptance and adoption
of the new iSCSI standard.&#160; If these new
products are not adopted by customers or do not achieve anticipated sales
levels, any related intangible assets we have recorded may be impaired.&#160; Such impairment would result in a charge
against earnings in the period for which impairment is determined to exist, and
reduce our assets and shareholders&#146; equity.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">We have not been involved previously in the development,
marketing and sale of software or disk-based products, and these areas are new
to many of our personnel.&#160; We will need
to continuously update and periodically upgrade these products to stay
competitive.&#160; Any delay in the
commercial release of new or enhanced software or disk-based products could
result in a significant loss of potential revenues and may adversely impact the
market price of our common stock.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">The software industry is highly competitive.&#160; Some of our competitors may have an
advantage due to their relationships with their customers and other third
parties and their significantly greater financial, technical, marketing and
other resources.&#160; Our competitors also
may have the ability to respond more quickly than we can to new or emerging
technologies and changes in customer requirements.&#160; This competition could seriously impede our ability to sell
software products on terms favorable to us.&#160;
In addition, our current and potential competitors may develop and
market new software products that render our existing or future products
obsolete, unmarketable or less competitive.&#160;
Our current and potential competitors may make strategic acquisitions or
establish cooperative relationships among themselves or with other competitors,
thereby increasing the availability of their services to address the needs of
our current and prospective customers.&#160;
We may not be able to compete successfully against our current and
future competitors, and competitive pressures that we encounter may seriously
harm our business.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">We license the majority of our software code from another
company and depend on that software developer for the timely delivery of
competitive, defect-free software that forms the basis for our software
products.&#160; In April&nbsp;2003, EMC
Corporation, one of our software competitors, acquired our software
licensor.&#160; As a result of this
acquisition, our software licensor has available substantially greater
financial and other resources, including an enhanced capability to develop and
market similar and competitive software offerings.&#160; Although EMC Corporation announced that it intends to continue
our software license relationship, our commercial arrangement may not develop
successfully and EMC Corporation could compete more directly with us.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">13</font></p>


<div style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="red" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><font color="red" style="color:red;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='13',FILE='C:\jms\jpatrow\03-3540-1\task28550\3540-1-be.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Sep 24 19:54 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font></font>

<p align="center" style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">If our software or disk-based products do not achieve market
acceptance or success, then the association of our brand name with these
products may adversely affect our reputation and our sales of other products,
as well as dilute the value of our brand name.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our warranty reserves may not adequately
cover our warranty obligations.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">We have
established reserves for the estimated liability associated with our product
warranties.&#160; However, we could
experience unforeseen circumstances where these or future reserves may not
adequately cover our warranty obligations.&#160;
For example, the failure or inadequate performance of product components
that we purchase could increase our warranty obligations beyond these reserves.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our credit facility is collateralized by a general security
interest in our assets.&#160; If we were to
default, then the lender would have the right to foreclose on our assets.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At June&nbsp;30, 2003,
our credit facility consisted of a $4.7 million five-year term note for capital
equipment purchases which matures on August&nbsp;28, 2007 and a $10 million
two-year revolving line of credit for working capital purposes which expires on
November&nbsp;30, 2003. At June&nbsp;30, 2003, $4.0 million, including $931,000
due within one year, was outstanding under the term note and no amounts were
outstanding under the line of credit.&#160;
Both the term note and the line of credit are collateralized by a
general security interest in our assets.&#160;
If we were to default under our credit facility, then the lender would
have the right to accelerate the indebtedness outstanding under our credit
facility and foreclose on our assets in order to satisfy our indebtedness.&#160; A foreclosure could have a material adverse
effect on our business, liquidity, results of operation and financial position.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our credit facility requires that we comply with several
financial and non-financial covenants.&#160;
If we fail to comply with these covenants, then we will be in default of
the credit facility.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The loan agreement that
governs our credit facility requires us to comply with several financial and
non-financial covenants.&#160; Our ability to
comply with these covenants may be affected by events beyond our control,
including prevailing economic, financial and industry conditions.&#160; A violation of one or more of these
covenants would constitute a default under the credit facility, which would
enable the lender, at its option without notice, to accelerate all
then-outstanding indebtedness under the credit facility and/or terminate the
lender&#146;s obligation to extend credit under the credit facility, either of which
could materially and adversely impact our business, liquidity, results of
operation and financial position.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Our success depends on our ability
to attract, retain and motivate our executives and other key personnel.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Our
future success depends in large part on our ability to attract, retain and
motivate our executives and other key personnel, many of whom have been
instrumental in developing new technologies and setting strategic plans.&#160; Our growth also depends in large part on our
continuing ability to hire, motivate and retain highly qualified management,
technical, sales and marketing team members. Competition for qualified
personnel is intense and there can be no assurance that we will retain existing
personnel or attract additional qualified personnel in the future.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Future mergers and acquisitions may
increase the risks associated with our business.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">In the
future, we may pursue mergers and acquisitions of complementary businesses,
products or technologies as we seek to expand and increase the value-added
component of our product offerings.&#160;
Mergers and acquisitions involve numerous risks, including liabilities
that we may assume from the acquired company, difficulties in the assimilation
of the operations and personnel of the acquired business, the diversion of
management&#146;s attention from other business concerns, risks of entering markets
in which we have no direct prior experience, and the potential loss of key
employees of the acquired business.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Future
mergers and acquisitions by us also may result in dilutive issuances of our
equity securities and the incurrence of additional debt and amortization
expenses related to intangible assets.&#160;
Any of these factors could adversely affect our business, liquidity,
results of operation and financial position.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">14</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='14',FILE='C:\jms\jpatrow\03-3540-1\task28550\3540-1-be.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Sep 24 19:54 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 2.&#160; <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Properties</font></i></font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We lease all
facilities used in our business.&#160; Our
headquarters are located in San Diego, California in a two-building light
industrial complex comprising approximately 160,000 square feet. The lease
expires in February&nbsp;2014 and can be renewed for one additional five-year
period. This San Diego facility houses all of our research and development,
manufacturing and administrative functions as well as a major portion of sales,
sales administration, marketing and customer support. In our current
facilities, we believe that we have and will have the capacity to support unit
production levels several times greater than our current rate of production.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We lease a 17,000
square foot facility located in Wokingham, England, which houses sales,
technical support and repair services. The lease expires in January&nbsp;2018.
We also maintain small sales offices located close to Paris, France, Munich,
Germany and Singapore.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The lease on the
facility located in Longmont, Colorado expires in November&nbsp;2005.&#160; We currently are working with the lessor to
mitigate the rental expense as the Longmont operations have been wound-down.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 3.&#160; <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Legal
Proceedings</font></i></font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January&nbsp;2003,
Raytheon Company filed a lawsuit against us and various other companies in the
United States District Court for the Eastern District of Texas.&#160; The complaint alleges that our products
infringe United States Patent No. 5,412,791, entitled Mass Data Storage
Library.&#160; In the complaint, Raytheon demands
that the defendants stop selling infringing products, pay Raytheon for their
past use of the invention under the patent and pay Raytheon&#146;s costs and
expenses and its reasonable attorney fees.&#160;
In February&nbsp;2003, Raytheon filed a First Amended Complaint stating
its original claim with more particularity. We filed an Answer and
Counterclaims to Raytheon&#146;s First Amended Complaint in March&nbsp;2003, denying
all material allegations in the complaint and asserting counterclaims seeking
to have Raytheon&#146;s &#145;791 patent declared invalid, unenforceable and not
infringed by us.&#160; In April&nbsp;2003,
Raytheon filed a Second Amended Complaint against the defendants containing the
same substantive infringement allegations and also adding a ninth
defendant.&#160; In May&nbsp;2003, we responded
to Raytheon&#146;s Second Amended Complaint with an Answer and Amended
Counterclaims, again contesting infringement, invalidity and enforceability of
the &#145;791 patent.&#160; This lawsuit is in its
early stages and discovery is just commencing.&#160;
The District Court held a scheduling conference in this matter in
May&nbsp;2003 and has set a case schedule with trial currently set for
June&nbsp;2004.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition to the
foregoing matter, we are from time to time involved in various lawsuits and
legal proceedings which arise in the ordinary course of business.&#160; We are currently not aware of any such legal
proceedings or claims which we believe will have, individually or in the
aggregate, a material adverse affect on our business, financial condition or
operating results.&#160; However, litigation
is subject to inherent uncertainties, and an adverse result in these or other
matters may arise from time to time that may harm our business.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 4.&#160; <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Submission
of Matters to a Vote of Security Holders</font></i></font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">None</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">15</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='15',FILE='C:\jms\jpatrow\03-3540-1\task28550\3540-1-be.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Sep 24 19:54 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;">&nbsp;</p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">PART II</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 5.&#160; <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Market for
Registrant&#146;s Common Equity and Related Shareholder Matters</font></i></font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our common stock trades
on The NASDAQ National Market under the symbol &#147;OVRL&#148;.&#160; As of September&nbsp;23, 2003, there were
approximately 120 shareholders of record.&#160;
We have not paid any dividends on our common stock and do not anticipate
paying any dividends in the foreseeable future.&#160; The high and low closing prices of our common stock from
July&nbsp;1, 2001 through June&nbsp;30, 2003 were as follows:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

</font></div>


<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Consists of our 1991
Non-Qualified Stock Option Plan, 1992-A Non-Qualified Stock Option Plan and
2001 Supplemental Stock Option Plan, each of which has not been approved by our
shareholders.&#160; Please see Note 8 of our
Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements for a description of these plans.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Recent Sales of Securities</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In May&nbsp;2003, we sold
1,430,000 shares of common stock at $15.39 per share in a private placement
transaction. Gross proceeds to Overland were $22,008,000 with net proceeds
after commission and offering expenses of $20,623,000.&#160; We intend to use the proceeds to fund
working capital needs in support of the growth of our business and for general
corporate purposes. These securities were offered and sold without registration
under the Securities Act to a limited number of accredited investors in
reliance upon the exemption provided by Rule 506 of Regulation D, and may not
be offered or sold in the United States in the absence of an effective
registration statement or exemption from the registration requirements under
the Securities Act. An appropriate legend was placed on the shares issued. The
shares issued are included in a currently effective registration statement for
their resale.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">16</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='16',FILE='C:\jms\jpatrow\03-3540-1\task28550\3540-1-be.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Sep 24 19:54 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June&nbsp;2003, we
issued 134,551 shares of our common stock valued at $2,705,000 to the former
shareholders of Okapi Software, Inc., as partial consideration for our
acquisition of Okapi. These securities were offered and sold without
registration under the Securities Act to a limited number of accredited and/or
sophisticated investors in reliance upon the exemption provided by Rule 506 of
Regulation D, and may not be offered or sold in the United States in the
absence of an effective registration statement or exemption from the
registration requirements under the Securities Act. We agreed to file a
registration statement covering the resale of the shares within six months
after the closing date.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 6.&#160; <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Selected
Financial Data</font></i></font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following selected
financial data has been derived from our audited consolidated financial
statements and the related notes.&#160; This
information should be read in conjunction with Item 7 of this Report -
&#147;Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of
Operations,&#148; and with our consolidated financial statements and the related
notes set forth at the pages indicated in Item 14(a)(1) of this Report.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.42%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.54%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">15,774</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.42%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
