<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-11</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-11',FILE='C:\jms\jpatrow\03-3540-1\task28550\3540-1-be.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Sep 24 19:54 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<h4 align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Stock-Based Compensation</font></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company measures
compensation expense for its stock-based employee compensation plans using the
intrinsic value method and provides pro forma disclosures of net income and
earnings per share as if the fair value-based method had been applied in
measuring compensation expense.&#160;
Compensation charges related to non-employee stock-based compensation
are measured using fair value methods and recognized as earned.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company accounts for
employee stock-based compensation using the intrinsic value method.&#160; In most cases, no compensation expense has
been recognized for its employee stock option grants, as they have been granted
at the fair market value of the underlying Common Stock at the date of
grant.&#160; No compensation expense has been
recognized for purchase rights under the ESPP as they have been granted in
accordance with the terms of the ESPP.<b><font style="font-weight:bold;">&#160; </font></b>Had
compensation expense for the Company&#146;s employee stock-based compensation awards
issued during 2003, 2002 and 2001 been determined based on a fair value method,
the Company&#146;s net income and net income per share would have been reduced to
the pro forma amounts indicated below:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="80%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:80.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="49%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:49.2%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.36%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="47%" colspan="8" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:47.24%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Year Ended
  June&nbsp;30,</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.18%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="49%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:49.2%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.36%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.18%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2003</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.36%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>

</table>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The fair value of
each option grant is estimated on the date of grant using a Black-Scholes
option-pricing model.&#160; The
weighted-average estimated fair value of employee stock options granted during
fiscal years 2003, 2002 and 2001 were $13.41, $6.42 and $6.27 per share, respectively.&#160; The weighted average assumptions used for
grants during the fiscal years 2003, 2002 and 2001 were: no dividend yield for
all years, risk-free interest rates of 3.7%, 4.8% and 5.5%, respectively,
expected volatility of 82%, 82% and 81%, respectively, and expected lives of
7.0 years for all fiscal years.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The fair value of each share purchase right under the
ESPP is estimated at the inception of each offering period also using a
Black-Scholes option-pricing model.&#160; The
weighted-average estimated fair value of each share purchase right granted
during fiscal years 2003, 2002 and 2001 were $4.65, $4.36 and $4.32 per share,
respectively.&#160; The weighted average
assumptions used during fiscal years 2003, 2002 and 2001 were: no dividend
yield for all years, risk-free interest rates of 3.7%, 4.8% and 5.5%,
respectively, expected volatility of 79%, 106% and 94%, respectively, and an
expected life of 6 months for all fiscal years.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-12</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-12',FILE='C:\jms\jpatrow\03-3540-1\task28550\3540-1-be.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Sep 24 19:54 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Reclassifications</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certain prior period
amounts have been reclassified to conform to the current year presentation.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Recent Accounting Pronouncements</font></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January&nbsp;2003, the
Financial Accounting Standards Board, or FASB, issued FASB Interpretation No.
46 (&#147;FIN 46&#148;), &#147;Consolidation of Variable Interest Entities.&#148;&#160; FIN 46 establishes accounting guidance for
consolidation of a variable interest entity (VIE), formerly referred to as
special purpose entities.&#160; FIN 46
applies to any business enterprise both public and private, that has a controlling
interest, contractual relationship or other business relationship with a
VIE.&#160; FIN 46 provides guidance for
determining when an entity (the Primary Beneficiary) should consolidate a VIE
that functions to support the activities of the Primary Beneficiary.&#160; The Company has no contractual relationship
or other business relationship with a VIE and therefore the adoption will not
have an effect on its consolidated results of operations or financial position.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTE 2 &#150; ACQUISITION AND DISPOSITION OF CERTAIN ASSETS</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">In June&nbsp;2003, the
Company acquired all of the assets and assumed all of the liabilities of Okapi
Software, Inc., a privately held company based in San Diego, California. This
acquisition was accounted for as an asset acquisition in accordance with SFAS
142, &#147;Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets.&#148; The Company&#146;s consolidated
statements of operations include the results of Okapi from the date of
acquisition.</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Okapi provided intelligent
disk-based storage appliances used by Information Technology managers to reduce
their back up window, speed restores and compliment tape back up strategies all
while fitting within existing infrastructure. Okapi&#146;s solution combines
proprietary management software with iSCSI and ATA disk technologies to create
high-speed, scalable and reliable disk-to-disk-to-tape solutions.&#160; Their solution accelerates backup by 50 to
90%; restores data in milliseconds; completes back up consistently and provides
a quick, reliable replication of critical data to secure, remote locations to
eliminate the need to transport magnetic tapes.&#160; Okapi&#146;s solution is an adjacent appliance that fills a customer
need and complements the Company&#146;s existing family of tape automation products.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">The
aggregate purchase price for the assets of Okapi of&#160; $5,364,000 was comprised of the issuance of 134,551 shares of
Overland stock valued at $2,705,000, cash of $2,500,000, and $159,000 of
acquisition related costs. Of the $5,364,000 purchase price, $41,000 was
allocated to the net tangible liabilities acquired and $8,983,000, which
includes a deferred tax liability, was allocated to acquired technology.&#160; As this transaction was accounted for as a
tax-free exchange, the Company recorded a deferred tax liability of $3,578,000.&#160; The acquired technology represented by the
intangible asset will be amortized over a five year life.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:40.5pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">In
June&nbsp;2001, the Company sold its Travan-based WS30 and EDT40 tape drive
designs (the &#147;Designs) to Seagate Removable Storage Solutions LLC, a Delaware
limited liability company now known as Certance LLC, in exchange for future
royalty payments based on the sales of certain tape drive products and related
tape media cartridges based on the Designs.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:40.5pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:40.5pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">As
a result of the sale of the Designs and the related exit of the entry-level
tape drive business in June&nbsp;2001, the Company recorded a pretax charge
of&#160; $2,535,000, including: $1,979,000 in
inventory impairments; $205,000 of lease exit costs related to the Company&#146;s
Longmont facility; $160,000 of severance costs; $142,000 in fixed asset
impairments; and legal fees. All accrued amounts, with the exception of the
lease exit costs, were paid during calendar year 2002.&#160; The lease exit costs are expected to be paid
over the remaining life of the lease.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the third quarter
of fiscal year 2001, the Company sold certain rights and assets (including the
product design together with all documentation, manufacturing rights, tooling
and inventory) of its automated SLR loader product to Tandberg Data for a
purchase price of $1,135,000. As a result of this transaction, the Company
recorded a pre-tax gain of $810,000 within other income.&#160; In connection with the sale, the Company
also will receive a per unit royalty on the first 6,000 SLR loader units that
are manufactured and sold by Tandberg Data.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-13</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-13',FILE='C:\jms\jpatrow\03-3540-1\task28550\3540-1-be.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Sep 24 19:54 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">NOTE 3 - COMPOSITION OF CERTAIN FINANCIAL STATEMENT
CAPTIONS</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Depreciation and
amortization expense was $2,354,000, $2,109,000 and $1,915,000 in fiscal years
2003, 2002 and 2001, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTE 4 &#150; INTANGIBLE ASSETS</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">At </font>June&nbsp;30,
2003, the Company had intangible assets of $8,983,000 consisting solely of the
technology purchased in the Okapi acquisition during fiscal year 2003 as
discussed in Note 2.&#160; At June&nbsp;30,
2002, the Company had no material intangible assets.&#160; During fiscal year 2003, no amounts were amortized due to the
timing of the acquisition near the end of the fiscal year.&#160; The Okapi technology will be amortized over
five years.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Estimated amortization
expense for this intangible asset will be approximately $1.8&nbsp;million for
the twelve months ending June&nbsp;30, 2004 and each of the four fiscal years
thereafter.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTE 5 - LONG-TERM DEBT</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">At </font>June&nbsp;30, 2003, the Company had a credit facility
consisting of a $4,655,000 five-year term note for capital equipment purchases
that matures on August&nbsp;28, 2007 and a $10,000,000 two-year revolving line
of credit for working capital purposes that expires on November&nbsp;30,
2003.&#160; Both the term note and the line
of credit are collateralized by the Company&#146;s assets.&#160; Interest on the term note is set at variable rates equal to the
bank&#146;s prime rate (4.00% on June&nbsp;30, 2003) in effect from time to
time.&#160; Interest on the line of credit is
set at the bank&#146;s prime rate in effect from time to time minus 0.25% or, at the
Company&#146;s option, a rate equal to LIBOR plus 2.25%.&#160; The loan agreement that governs the credit facility contains
certain financial and non-financial covenants.&#160;
The term note provided for a nine-month draw period through
August&nbsp;28, 2002, during which period only interest was paid.&#160; Upon expiration of the draw period, all
amounts outstanding under the note are payable in 60 equal payments of
principal plus interest.&#160; At
June&nbsp;30, 2003, $3,957,000, including $931,000 due within one year, was outstanding
under the term note and no amounts were outstanding under the line of credit.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-14</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-14',FILE='C:\jms\jpatrow\03-3540-1\task28550\3540-1-be.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Sep 24 19:54 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The aggregate
maturities for long-term debt for the five years after June&nbsp;30, 2003 are
$931,000 for the twelve months ending June&nbsp;30, 2004, $1,009,000 for the
twelve months ending June&nbsp;30, 2005, $931,000 for each of the twelve months
ending June&nbsp;30, 2006 and 2007, and $155,000 for the twelve months ending
June&nbsp;30 2008.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTE 6 - INCOME TAXES</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The components of income before income tax provisions
were as follows:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

</div>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The provision for
income taxes includes the following:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 202.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="60%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:60.02%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="44%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:44.6%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.58%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="51%" colspan="8" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:51.68%;">

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A reconciliation
of income taxes computed by applying the federal statutory income tax rate of
34% to income before income taxes to the total income tax provision reported in
the Consolidated Statement of Operations is as follows:</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-15</font></p>


<div align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

  </td>
  <td width="18%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:18.94%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(416</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.5%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="54%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:54.3%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net
  deferred income taxes</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:3.18%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.16%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.78%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">260</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:3.16%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.16%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>

  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3,236</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:1.5%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">No valuation
allowance was recorded as of June&nbsp;30, 2003 or 2002, as the Company
believes it is more likely than not the deferred tax assets will be realized.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">NOTE 7 - COMMON STOCK</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">On
May&nbsp;15, 2003, the Company sold 1,430,000 shares of common stock in a
private placement transaction.&#160; The
stock was sold at $15.39, a 10 percent discount to the closing market price on
May&nbsp;12, 2003. Gross proceeds to Overland were $22,008,000 with net
proceeds after commission and offering expenses of $20,623,000. Proceeds will
be used by the Company to fund working capital needs in support of the growth
of its business and for general corporate purposes.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">NOTE 8 -&#160; STOCK
OPTIONS</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has seven active stock option plans,
administered by the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors, which
provide for the issuance of options to employees, officers, directors and
consultants.&#160; As of June&nbsp;30, 2003,
the Company had reserved 4,774,990 shares of common stock for issuance under
the 1991 Non-Qualified Stock Option Plan (&#147;1991 Plan&#148;), 1993 Stock Option Plan,
1993-A Stock Option Plan, 1992-A Non-Qualified Stock Option Plan (&#147;1992 Plan&#148;),
1995 Stock Option Plan (&#147;1995 Plan&#148;), 1997 Executive Stock Option Plan (&#147;1997
Plan&#148;), 2000 Stock Option Plan (&#147;2000 Plan&#148;), and the 2001 Supplemental Stock
Option Plan (&#147;2001 Plan&#148;) (collectively, the &#147;Option Plans&#148;).&#160; The Option Plans provide for the granting of
stock options equal to the fair market value of the Company&#146;s Common Stock on
the date the option is granted.&#160; The
Option Plans have been approved by shareholders with the exception of the 1991
Plan, the 1992 Plan, and the 2001 Plan.&#160;
Currently, the Company may grant options only from the 1995 Plan, the
1997 Plan, the 2000 Plan and the 2001 Plan.&#160;
Certain options issued under selected plans call for 100% vesting of
outstanding options upon a change of control of the Company.&#160; Options granted during the last three fiscal
years generally vest over a three year period, with monthly vesting from the
date of grant.&#160; Options granted in prior
years generally vested at a rate of 25% per year over a four-year period from
the date of grant.&#160; Options expire after
a period not to exceed ten years, except in the event of termination, whereupon
vested shares must be exercised generally within 30 days, or upon death or
disability, where an extended six or twelve-month exercise period is
specified.&#160; As of June&nbsp;30, 2003,
approximately 3.3 million shares are reserved for issuance upon exercise of
outstanding options and approximately 80,000 are available for grant under the
Option Plans.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-16</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table summarizes information about stock
options outstanding as of June&nbsp;30, 2003:</font></p>

 <tr>
  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.88%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.58%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="47%" colspan="6" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:47.88%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Options
  Outstanding</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.58%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="31%" colspan="4" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:31.04%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Options
  Exercisable</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.04%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-17</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-17',FILE='C:\jms\jpatrow\03-3540-1\task28550\3540-1-be.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Sep 24 19:54 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">1996 Employee Stock Purchase Plan</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
February&nbsp;1997, the Company adopted the 1996 Employee Stock Purchase Plan
(the &#147;ESPP&#148;) whereby 250,000 shares of Common Stock were reserved for issuance
and purchase by employees of the Company to assist them in acquiring a stock
ownership interest in the Company and to encourage them to remain employees of
the Company.&#160; In November&nbsp;1998, the
shareholders approved an amendment to increase the total number of shares of
Common Stock from 250,000 to 500,000 shares.&#160;
The ESPP is intended to qualify under Section&nbsp;423 of the Internal
Revenue Code and permits eligible employees to purchase Common Stock at a
discount through payroll deductions during specified six-month offering periods.&#160; No employee may purchase more than $25,000
worth of stock in any calendar year or 1,500 shares in any one offering period.
The ESPP is administered by the Compensation Committee appointed by the Board
of Directors and provides generally that the purchase price must not be less
than 85% of the fair market value of the Common Stock on the first or last day
of the offering period, whichever is lower.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During fiscal
years 2003, 2002 and 2001, a total of 40,720, 51,076 and 71,634 shares,
respectively, were issued for combined proceeds of $405,000, $301,000 and
$601,000, respectively.&#160; As of
June&nbsp;30, 2003 approximately 108,000 shares were available for grant.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">NOTE 9 - 401(k) PLAN</font></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January&nbsp;1994, the Company adopted an employee
savings and retirement plan (the &#147;401(k) Plan&#148;) covering all of the Company&#146;s
employees.&#160; The 401(k) Plan permits but
does not require matching contributions by the Company on behalf of all
participants.&#160; The Company matches
employee contributions at 75%, for up to 6% of an employee&#146;s pretax
income.&#160; The totals of these employer
contributions were $520,000, $538,000 and $562,000 in fiscal years 2003, 2002
and 2001, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">NOTE 10 &#150; ACCRUED RESTRUCTURING CHARGES</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">During
the fourth quarter of fiscal year 2001, the Company recorded a pretax charge of
$2,535,000, including $2,172,000 in inventory and fixed asset impairments and
$363,000 of restructuring charges, related to the sale of its Travan-based WS30
and EDT40 tape drive designs and related assets and the exit of the entry-level
tape drive business including the planned closure of its Longmont, Colorado
facility.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">During
fiscal year 2002, the Company increased the restructuring accrual for facility
rent by $228,000 to reflect an adjustment in the estimated liability related to
the closure of the Longmont facility, based upon the increased amount of time
the Company believed would be required to sublease the facility, given the
weakening real estate market in Longmont, Colorado.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:45.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Subsequent to the termination of the Travan based
development project in May&nbsp;2002, the Company temporarily used the Longmont
facility for certain engineering operations primarily related to its software
products.&#160; During the third quarter of
fiscal year 2003, the Company completed the relocation of all operations from
the Longmont facility to its San Diego headquarters.&#160; After the relocation the Company re-evaluated its accrual related
to the Longmont facility lease.&#160; While the
Company continues to pursue sub-lease opportunities, based upon the current commercial
real estate market in Longmont, it determined that it was unlikely that it will
be able to sub-lease the property and recorded an additional charge of $156,000
as an operating expense within research and development to accrue all of the
remaining payments due under the lease.&#160;
The accrued facility costs are expected to be paid over the remaining
life of the lease, which expires in November&nbsp;2005.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">F-18</font></b></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></b></div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTE 11 - COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENCIES</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Leases</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company leases its
office, production and sales facilities under non-cancelable operating leases,
which expire in various years through fiscal year 2018.&#160; The leases provide for biennial or annual
rent escalations intended to approximate increases in cost of living indices,
and certain of the leases provide for rent abatement.&#160; At June&nbsp;30, 2003, future minimum lease payments under these
arrangements are as follows:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="6%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:6.16%;">

</div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During fiscal year 2001,
the Company entered into an operating lease agreement for a new 158,000 square
foot headquarter facility to be constructed in San Diego, California.&#160; The lease commenced upon the Company&#146;s
occupancy of the building in February&nbsp;2002.&#160; The lease is for a period of twelve years and can be renewed for
one additional five-year period.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As security for the
lease, the Company has issued to the landlord a $1,000,000 letter of credit
which is subject to reduction upon the maintenance of certain financial
covenants and the passage of time.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Rental expense is
recognized ratably over the respective lease terms and aggregated $3,843,000,
$2,520,000 and $1,780,000 for fiscal years 2003, 2002 and 2001, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-19</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-19',FILE='C:\jms\jpatrow\03-3540-1\task28550\3540-1-be.htm',USER='jpatrow',CD='Sep 24 19:54 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<h4 align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Guarantees</font></b></h4>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s standard
warranty is a three year advance replacement return-to-factory warranty that
covers both parts and labor.&#160; For
products that it distributes and for drives and tapes used in its products that
are manufactured by a third party, the Company passes on to the customer the
warranty provided by the manufacturer.&#160;
The Company also provides on-site service for the first warranty year of
its higher-end products, for which it contracts with third-party service providers.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company provides for
the estimated cost of product warranties at the time revenue is
recognized.&#160; The Company&#146;s product
warranty liability reflects its best estimate of probable liability under its
product warranties.&#160; The Company
estimates the warranty based on expected product failure rates, historical
experience, and other currently available information.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company also sells
extended on-site warranties for certain products for which revenue is deferred
and recognized over the warranty period.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Changes in the
liability for product warranty and deferred revenue associated with extended
warranties for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2003 were as follows (in
thousands):</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Litigation</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company is subject to various legal proceedings
and claims that arise in the ordinary course of business.&#160; In the opinion of management, the amount of
any ultimate liability with respect to these actions will not materially affect
the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements or results of operations.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On January&nbsp;10, 2003, Raytheon Company filed a
lawsuit against the Company and various other companies in the United States
District Court for the Eastern District of Texas.&#160; The complaint alleges that the Companies products infringe United
States Patent No. 5,412,791, entitled Mass Data Storage Library.&#160; In the complaint, Raytheon demands that the
defendants stop selling infringing products, pay Raytheon for their past use of
the invention under the patent and pay Raytheon&#146;s costs and expenses and its
reasonable attorney fees.&#160; On
February&nbsp;6, 2003, Raytheon filed a First Amended Complaint stating its
original claim with more particularity. The Company filed its Answer and
Counterclaims to Raytheon&#146;s First Amended Complaint on or about March&nbsp;5,
2003, denying all material allegations in the complaint and asserting
counterclaims seeking to have Raytheon&#146;s &#145;791 patent declared invalid,
unenforceable and not infringed by the Company.&#160; On or about April&nbsp;22, 2003, Raytheon filed a Second Amended
Complaint against the defendants containing the same substantive infringement
allegations and also adding a ninth defendant.&#160;
On or about May&nbsp;29, 2003, the Company responded to Raytheon&#146;s
Second Amended Complaint with its Answer and Amended Counterclaims, again
contesting infringement, invalidity and enforceability of the &#145;791 patent.&#160; This lawsuit is in its early stages and
discovery is just commencing.&#160; The
District Court held a scheduling conference in this matter on May&nbsp;20, 2003
and has set a case schedule with trial currently set for June&nbsp;2004.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company has not recorded any accrual for contingent liability associated with
the legal proceedings described above based on the Company&#146;s belief that a
liability, while possible, is not probable.&#160;
Further, any possible range of loss cannot be estimated at this time.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-20</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTE 12 &#150; SELECTED QUARTERLY FINANCIAL DATA (UNAUDITED)</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table
presents selected quarterly financial information for the periods
indicated.&#160; This information has been
derived from the Company&#146;s unaudited quarterly consolidated financial
statements, which in the opinion of management includes all adjustments (consisting
only of normal recurring adjustments) necessary for a fair presentation of such
information.&#160; The quarterly per share
data presented below was calculated separately and may not sum to the annual
figures presented in the Consolidated Financial Statements. These operating
results are also not necessarily indicative of results for any future period.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">OVERLAND DATA, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><a name="ScheduleIi"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">SCHEDULE
II</font></b></a><b><font style="font-weight:bold;"> &#150; VALUATION AND QUALIFYING ACCOUNTS</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FISCAL YEARS ENDED JUNE&nbsp;30,
2003, 2002 and 2001</font></b></p>

<body link="blue" vlink="purple">

<div style="font-family:'Times New Roman';">

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">EXHIBIT 2.1</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">AGREEMENT AND PLAN OF MERGER</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">by and among</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">OVERLAND STORAGE, INC.,</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">OKAPI ACQUISITION CO., INC.,</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">OKAPI SOFTWARE, INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">and</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">THE SHAREHOLDERS<br>
IDENTIFIED ON <u>SCHEDULE 2.3<br>
</u>ATTACHED HERETO</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Dated as of June&nbsp;20, 2003</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.7%;">

  Definitions</a></font></p>
  </td>

  <td width="16%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.78%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#ExhibitB" title="Click to goto EXHIBIT B">Exhibit&nbsp;B</a></font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.7%;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">iv</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='iv',FILE='C:\jms\rcheney\03-3540-1\task28094\3540-1-ke.htm',USER='rcheney',CD='Sep 23 12:35 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">AGREEMENT AND PLAN OF MERGER</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">THIS AGREEMENT</font></b>  <b><font style="font-weight:bold;">AND PLAN OF MERGER </font></b>(this &#147;<u>Agreement</u>&#148;)
is made and entered into as of June&nbsp;20, 2003, by and among: (i) Overland
Storage, Inc., a California corporation (&#147;<u>Overland</u>&#148;); (ii) Okapi
Acquisition Co., Inc., a California corporation and a wholly-owned subsidiary
of Overland (&#147;<u>Acquisition Sub</u>&#148;); (iii) Okapi Software, Inc., a
California corporation (&#147;<u>Target</u>&#148;); and (iv) the shareholders of Target,
each of which is identified on <u>Schedule&nbsp;2.3</u> attached hereto (each,
a &#147;<u>Target Shareholder</u>,&#148; and collectively, the &#147;<u>Target Shareholders</u>&#148;).&#160; Certain capitalized terms used in this
Agreement are defined on <u>Exhibit&nbsp;A</u> hereto.&#160; Each of Overland, Acquisition Sub, Target
and the Target Shareholders is referred to herein as a &#147;<u>Party</u>,&#148; and,
collectively, as the &#147;<u>Parties</u>.&#148;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">RECITALS</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">WHEREAS</font></b>, Target is
engaged in the business of developing and commercializing disk to disk storage
appliances in the backup and recovery market for small to medium size
businesses (the &#147;<u>Business</u>&#148;);</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">WHEREAS, </font></b>Overland
desires to acquire Target through the merger of Target with and into
Acquisition Sub (the &#147;<u>Merger</u>&#148;); and</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">WHEREAS, </font></b>the Parties
intend, by executing this Agreement, to adopt a plan of reorganization within
the meaning of Section&nbsp;368 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as
amended (the &#147;<u>Code</u>&#148;), and to cause the Merger to qualify as a
reorganization under Section&nbsp;368 of the Code;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NOW, THEREFORE</font></b>, in
consideration of the foregoing recitals and the mutual representations,
warranties, covenants and promises contained herein, the adequacy and
sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the Parties agree as follows:</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">AGREEMENT</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h1 style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.25in;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:-1.25in;"><a name="Article1"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ARTICLE 1</font></b></a>.&#160; THE MERGER</h1>

<h1 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.25in;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:-1.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h1>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">1.1 <a name="TheMerger">The Merger</a>.</font></b>&#160; Subject to and upon the terms and conditions
of this Agreement and the applicable provisions of the General Corporation Law
of the State of California, at the Effective Time (as defined below), Target
shall be merged with and into Acquisition Sub, the separate corporate existence
of Target shall cease and Acquisition Sub shall continue as the surviving
corporation.&#160; Acquisition Sub as the
surviving corporation after the Merger is referred to hereinafter sometimes as
the &#147;<u>Surviving Corporation</u>.&#148;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">1.2 <a name="EffectiveTime">Effective Time</a>.</font></b>&#160; Subject to the terms and conditions of this
Agreement, as soon as practicable on the Closing Date (as defined below), the
Parties shall cause the Merger to be consummated by the filing with the
Secretary of State of the State of California of an agreement of merger
substantially in the form attached hereto as <u>Exhibit&nbsp;B</u> (the &#147;<u>Agreement
of Merger</u>&#148;), in accordance with Sections 1101 and 1103 of the General
Corporation Law of the State of California (the time of acceptance of such
filing by the Secretary of State of the State of</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='1',FILE='C:\jms\rcheney\03-3540-1\task28094\3540-1-ke.htm',USER='rcheney',CD='Sep 23 12:35 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">California, or such later time
as may be agreed in writing by the Parties and specified in the Agreement of
Merger, being the &#147;<u>Effective Time</u>&#148;).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">1.3 <a name="EffectOfTheMerger">Effect of the
Merger</a>.</font></b>&#160; At
the Effective Time, the effect of the Merger shall be as provided in this
Agreement and the applicable provisions of the General Corporation Law of the
State of California.&#160; Without limiting
the generality of the foregoing, and subject thereto, at the Effective Time,
except as otherwise provided by this Agreement, all the property, rights,
privileges, powers and franchises of Target shall vest in Acquisition Sub, and
all debts, liabilities and duties of Target shall become the debts, liabilities
and duties of Acquisition Sub.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">1.4 <a name="ArticlesOf">Articles of</a>
Incorporation and Bylaws.</font></b>&#160; Unless otherwise determined by Overland prior to the Effective
Time, the Articles of Incorporation of
Acquisition Sub as in effect immediately prior to the Effective Time shall be
the Articles of Incorporation of the Surviving Corporation, and the Bylaws of
Acquisition Sub in effect immediately prior to the Effective Time shall be the
Bylaws of the Surviving Corporation.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">1.5 <a name="Directors">Directors</a> and
Officers.</font></b>&#160;
Unless otherwise determined by Overland prior to the Effective Time, the directors of Acquisition Sub immediately prior
to the Effective Time shall be the directors of the Surviving Corporation, each
to hold office in accordance with the Articles of Incorporation and Bylaws of
the Surviving Corporation, and the officers of Acquisition Sub immediately
prior to the Effective Time shall be the officers of the Surviving Corporation,
in each case until their respective successors are duly elected and qualified.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h1 style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.25in;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:-1.25in;"><a name="Article2"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ARTICLE 2</font></b></a>.&#160; MERGER CONSIDERATION; EXCHANGE OF CERTIFICATES</h1>

<h1 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.25in;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:-1.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h1>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><a name="A21conversionoftarg"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2.1
Conversion of Targ</font></b></a><b><font style="font-weight:bold;">et Common Stock.</font></b>&#160; At
the Effective Time, by virtue of the Merger and without any action on the part
of any Person, each share of Target Common Stock issued and outstanding
immediately prior to the Effective Time (the &#147;<u>Outstanding Target Common
Stock</u>&#148;), shall be canceled and automatically converted into the right to
receive, upon surrender of the certificates representing such shares, a pro
rata portion of the Merger Consideration (as defined below).&#160; At the Effective Time, all rights in respect
of the Outstanding Target Common Stock shall cease to exist, other than the
right to receive a pro rata portion of the Merger Consideration.&#160; Any share of Target Common Stock held in the
treasury of Target shall be canceled and retired without payment of any consideration
therefor.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2.2 <a name="MergerConsideration_">Merger
Consideration.</a></font></b>&#160; The merger consideration (the &#147;<u>Merger
Consideration</u>&#148;) shall consist of the Overland Merger Shares and the Cash
Consideration.&#160; The term &#147;<u>Overland
Merger Shares</u>&#148; shall mean the number of shares of Overland Common Stock
that are valued in the aggregate at Two Million Five Hundred Thousand Dollars
($2,500,000), with the value of such shares to be determined based on the
average closing price of Overland Common Stock on the Nasdaq National Market
System during the twenty (20) trading days immediately preceding the date of
this Agreement; <u>provided</u>, <u>however</u>, that the number of Overland
Merger Shares shall not exceed One Hundred and Sixty Thousand (160,000)
shares.&#160; The term &#147;<u>Cash Consideration</u>&#148;
shall mean Two Million Five Hundred Thousand Dollars ($2,500,000), minus: (i)
the aggregate amount of principal and accrued interest outstanding as of the
Closing Date under any promissory notes payable by Target to John Matze; (ii)
the aggregate amount of Target&#146;s payroll accrual for John Matze as of the
Closing Date; and (iii) the aggregate amount owed by Target to</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='2',FILE='C:\jms\rcheney\03-3540-1\task28094\3540-1-ke.htm',USER='rcheney',CD='Sep 23 12:35 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Garage Securities, Inc. as of
the Closing Date.&#160; As detailed on <u>Schedule&nbsp;2.2</u>
attached hereto, Overland and certain of the Target Shareholders hereby agree
that Overland shall withhold, and pay over to the appropriate taxing
authorities in a timely manner, from the respective portions of the Cash
Consideration otherwise payable to such Target Shareholders: (A) certain income
and payroll taxes (and related FICA and FUTA withholding taxes) required to be
paid in connection with the acceleration of the vesting of shares of
Outstanding Target Common Stock held by such Target Shareholders and/or the
exercise by such Target Shareholders of certain Target Options (the &#147;<u>Target
Shareholder Closing Taxes</u>&#148;); and (B) to effect the cashless exercise of
such Target Options, the aggregate exercise price of such Target Options.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2.3 <a name="DeliveryOfMerger">Delivery of
Merger</a> Consideration.</font></b>&#160; At the Closing, Target shall deliver to Overland all certificates
representing shares of Outstanding Target Common Stock, and Overland shall: (i)
deliver to each Target Shareholder a certificate representing his or her pro
rata portion of the Overland Merger Shares, in accordance with the Target
Shareholders&#146; respective pro rata interests set forth on <u>Schedule&nbsp;2.3</u>
(&#147;<u>Pro Rata Interests</u>&#148;); and (ii) pay to each Target Shareholder a pro
rata portion of the Cash Consideration, in accordance with the Target
Shareholders&#146; Pro Rata Interests, less any amounts to be withheld by Overland
pursuant to the last sentence of <u>Section&nbsp;2.2</u>.&#160; As provided below in <u>Section&nbsp;6.11</u>,
the Parties shall amend <u>Schedule&nbsp;2.3</u> to reflect any additional
shares of Target Common Stock that Target issues prior to the Closing
Date.&#160; Immediately following the
Effective Time, Overland shall pay to John Matze: (i) the aggregate amount of
principal and accrued interest outstanding as of the Closing Date under any
promissory notes payable by Target to John Matze; and (ii) the aggregate amount
of Target&#146;s payroll accrual for John Matze as of the Closing Date.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2.4 <a name="NoFractional">No Fractional </a>Shares.</font></b>&#160; In lieu of fractional shares of Overland
Common Stock that would otherwise be issued to any Target Shareholder under
this Agreement, each Target Shareholder who would have been entitled to receive
a fractional share shall receive instead an amount in cash equal to the fair
market value of such fractional share, as determined by Overland in accordance
with Section&nbsp;407 of the General Corporation Law of the State of
California.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h1 style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.25in;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:-1.25in;"><a name="Article3"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ARTICLE 3</font></b></a>.&#160; CLOSING AND CLOSING DELIVERIES</h1>

<h1 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.25in;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:-1.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h1>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">3.1 <a name="ClosingTimeAndPlace">Closing; Time
and Place</a>.</font></b>&#160;
The closing (the &#147;<u>Closing</u>&#148;) of the Merger shall occur at the
offices of Morrison &amp; Foerster LLP, 3811 Valley Centre Drive, Suite 500, at
10:00 A.M. on June&nbsp;24, 2003, or at such other date, time or place as
Overland and Target may agree (the &#147;<u>Closing Date</u>&#148;).</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">3.2 <a name="Deli">Deli</a>veries by Target and
Target Shareholders.</font></b>&#160;
On the Closing Date, Target and the Target Shareholders shall deliver
the following items, all of which shall be in a form and substance reasonably
acceptable to Overland and Overland&#146;s counsel:</p>
